graderinfo.text: Database marketing is the application of business intelligence systems to the planning, execution, and assessment of marketing programs. Databases are a key component of database marketing, but data mining techniques are also very important.

a customer has bought the most expensive items
a customer has frequently ordered expensive items
a customer has purchased the least expensive items

One of their valued customers has an RFM score of 545. In this case, the ideal action for Cheryl's sales team is to ________.

name.text: q018 RFM scores are basically beneficial to salespeople, as it gives a clear pic

name.text: q019 A reporting system that generates RFM data can be automated.

questiontext.text: A reporting system that generates RFM data can be automated.

name.text: q020 Describe the process of conducting RFM analysis.

questiontext.text: Describe the process of conducting RFM analysis.

graderinfo.text:
RFM analysis is a way of analyzing and ranking customers according to their purchasing patterns. It is a simple technique that considers how recently (R) a customer has ordered, how frequently (F) a customer orders, and how much money (M) the customer spends per order.
To produce an RFM score, the program first sorts customer purchase records by the date of most recent (R) purchase. In a common form of this analysis, the program then divides the customers into five groups and gives customers in each group a score of 1 to 5. The 20 percent of the customers having the most recent orders are given an R score of 1, the 20 percent of the customers having the next most recent orders are given an R score of 2, and the last 20 percent are given an R score of 5.
The program then re-sorts the customers on the basis of how frequently they order. The 20 percent of the customers who order most frequently are given an F score of 1, the next 20 percent of most frequently ordering customers are given a score of 2, and the least frequently ordering customers are given an F score of 5.
Finally, the program sorts the customers again according to the amount spent on their orders. The 20 percent who have ordered the most expensive items are given an M score of 1, the next 20 percent are given an M score of 2, and the 20 percent who spend the least are given an M score of 5.

name.text: q032 What is a market-basket analysis?

questiontext.text: What is a market-basket analysis?

graderinfo.text: A market-basket analysis is a data mining technique for determining sales patterns. A market-basket analysis shows the products that customers tend to buy together. This gives companies an opportunity to cross-sell.

name.text: q033 Define the three market-basket terminologies: support, confidence, and lift

questiontext.text: Define the three market-basket terminologies: support, confidence, and lift.

graderinfo.text: In market-basket terminology, support is the probability that two items will be purchased together. A conditional probability estimate is called the confidence. The ratio of confidence to the base probability of buying an item is called lift. Lift shows how much the base probability increases or decreases when other products are purchased.

name.text: q038 Groups created by decision tree algorithms are as different from each other

questiontext.text: Groups created by decision tree algorithms are as different from each other as possible.

name.text: q039 A minimum difference among groups is used as the criterion for constructing

questiontext.text: A minimum difference among groups is used as the criterion for constructing the decision tree.

name.text: q040 What are decision trees? How do they classify people into groups?

questiontext.text: What are decision trees? How do they classify people into groups?

graderinfo.text:
A decision tree is a hierarchical arrangement of criteria that predicts a classification or value. Decision tree analysis is an unsupervised data mining technique. An analyst sets up a computer program and provides the data to analyze, and the decision tree program produces the tree. The basic idea of a decision tree is to select attributes that are most useful for classifying entities on some criterion.
The user should input data about different attributes into the decision tree program. The program then analyzes all of the attributes and selects an attribute that creates the most disparate groups. The logic is that the more different the groups, the better the classification will be. A decision tree program creates groups that are as pure as possible. A common business application of decision trees is to classify loans by likelihood of default.

name.text: q005 What are reporting systems? What are the fundamental operations they perfor

questiontext.text: What are reporting systems? What are the fundamental operations they perform?

graderinfo.text: A reporting system is an information system that creates information by processing data from disparate sources and delivering that information to the proper users on a timely basis. Reporting systems manipulate data into meaningful context using four fundamental operations: (1) filtering data, (2) sorting data, (3) grouping data, and (4) making simple calculations on the data.

name.text: q023 How does a reporting system obtain the necessary data to generate reports?

questiontext.text: How does a reporting system obtain the necessary data to generate reports?

graderinfo.text: Data from disparate data sources are read and combined, using filtering, sorting, grouping, and simple calculating, to produce information. Some data are generated within an organization, other data are obtained from public sources, and still other data may be purchased from data utilities.

name.text: q024 Explain the different types of reports.

questiontext.text: Explain the different types of reports.

graderinfo.text: The different types of reports are static reports, dynamic reports, query reports, and online analytical processing (OLAP) reports. Static reports are prepared once from underlying data, and they do not change. A report of past year's sales, for example, is a static report. Other reports are dynamic; at the time of creation, the reporting system reads the most current data and generates the report using that fresh data. A report on sales today and a report on current stock prices are both dynamic reports. Query reports are prepared in response to data entered by users. Online analytical processing (OLAP) is a fourth type of report. OLAP reports allow users to dynamically change report grouping structures and to sum, count, average, and perform other simple arithmetic operations on groups of data.

name.text: q025 What is the difference between push and pull reports?

questiontext.text: What is the difference between push and pull reports?

graderinfo.text: Organizations send a push report to users according to a preset schedule. Users receive the report without any activity on their part. In contrast, users must request a pull report. To obtain a pull report, a user goes to a Web portal or digital dashboard and clicks a link or button to cause the reporting system to produce and deliver the report.

name.text: q026 ________ involves connecting to data sources, creating report structures, a

questiontext.text: ________ involves connecting to data sources, creating report structures, and formatting reports.

name.text: q027 The ________ in a reporting system indicate the channel to be used for send

questiontext.text: The ________ in a reporting system indicate the channel to be used for sending a report to a user and whether the report is to be pushed or pulled.

name.text: q028 The ________ function of a reporting system pushes reports or allows them t

questiontext.text: The ________ function of a reporting system pushes reports or allows them to be pulled according to report management metadata.

name.text: q029 For query reports, the report delivery system serves as an intermediary bet

questiontext.text: For query reports, the report delivery system serves as an intermediary between a user and a report generator.

name.text: q030 Explain report authoring, report management, and report delivery.

questiontext.text: Explain report authoring, report management, and report delivery.

graderinfo.text: Report authoring involves connecting to data sources, creating a report structure, and formatting the report. Organizations can author reports by using a developer tool like Microsoft's Visual Studio. The purpose of report management is to define who receives what reports, when, and by what means. Most report management systems allow a report administrator to define user accounts and user groups and to assign particular users to particular groups. The report delivery function of a reporting system pushes reports or allows them to be pulled according to report management metadata. Reports can be delivered via an email server, via a Web site, via SOA services, or by other program-specific means.

questiontext.text: Which of the following statements is TRUE of dimensional databases?

They are structured to support OLAP processing.
They specialize in sorting functions alone.
They specialize in filtering functions alone.

name.text: q039 In online analytical processing (OLAP) reports, a dimension refers to an it

questiontext.text: In online analytical processing (OLAP) reports, a dimension refers to an item that is to be processed in the report.

name.text: q041 Users are not allowed to alter the format of online analytical processing (

questiontext.text: Users are not allowed to alter the format of online analytical processing (OLAP) reports.

name.text: q042 The process of dividing the data in online analytical processing (OLAP) rep

questiontext.text: The process of dividing the data in online analytical processing (OLAP) reports into more details is termed drill down.

name.text: q043 An online analytical processing (OLAP) server reads data from an operationa

questiontext.text: An online analytical processing (OLAP) server reads data from an operational database, performs preliminary calculations, and stores the results of those calculations in an OLAP database.

name.text: q044 Describe online analytical processing (OLAP).

questiontext.text: Describe online analytical processing (OLAP).

graderinfo.text: Online analytical processing (OLAP) provides the ability to sum, count, average, and perform other simple arithmetic operations on groups of data. A remarkable characteristic of OLAP reports is that their format is dynamic. The viewer of a report can change the report's structure. An OLAP report has measures and dimensions. A measure is the data item of interest. It is the item that is to be summed or averaged or otherwise processed in the OLAP report. A dimension is a characteristic of a measure.

answer.text: It is a high power-consuming computing device.
It is not capable of wireless connectivity.
It is a small and lightweight device.

questiontext.text: Mobile systems are information systems that support users in motion.

name.text: q005 Mobile systems users only move geographically, not from device to device.

questiontext.text: Mobile systems users only move geographically, not from device to device.

questiontext.text: A mobile device is a small, lightweight, power-conserving computing device that is capable of wireless connectivity.

name.text: q007 What are mobile systems?

questiontext.text: What are mobile systems?

graderinfo.text: Mobile systems are information systems that support users in motion. Mobile systems users access the system from any place–at home, at work, while traveling–using any smart device, such as smartphone, tablet, or PC. Mobile systems users move not only geographically, they also move from device to device. The major elements in a mobile system are users in motion, mobile devices, wireless connectivity, and cloud-based resources.

name.text: q008 In the context of industry changes, which of the following statements is TR

questiontext.text: In the context of industry changes, which of the following statements is TRUE of mobile systems?

answer.text: They consist of data that create a premium on the ability to memorize vast quantities of product data.
The scope of advertising is high.
The usage of mobile systems results in organizations being effective with part-time employees and independent contractors.
They consist of data that remove the premium for the ability to access, query, and present the data.

name.text: q009 Which of the following is TRUE about the impact of mobile systems on data u

questiontext.text: Which of the following is TRUE about the impact of mobile systems on data usage in information systems?

answer.text: Quantity of data available has been reduced.

name.text: q010 Continually evolving software leads to a decline in entrepreneurial opportu

questiontext.text: Continually evolving software leads to a decline in entrepreneurial opportunities.

name.text: q011 Briefly describe the mobile system effect for each of the five components o

questiontext.text: Briefly describe the mobile system effect for each of the five components of an information system.

graderinfo.text:
The five components of an information system are: hardware, software, data, procedures, and people. The impact of mobile system growth on each of these components is as follows:
Hardware: The increasing demand of mobile systems means sales of many more mobile devices, at the expense of PC sales.
Software: The reduced size of mobile devices requires the invention of new, innovative, and compact interfaces. Applications will need to scale with the invention of new technology for active users.
Data: Many more mobile systems mean an incredible amount of new data used to create much more information. Mobile systems can cause organizations to lose control over their data. Data leakage is inevitable.
Procedures: Mobile systems are always on, and people who use mobile systems are equally always at work. Employee lifestyle becomes a hybrid of personal and professional.
People: Mobile systems increase the speed of business, giving an advantage to those who can nimbly respond to changing conditions and succeed with the unexpected. Ability to thrive in a dynamic environment is more important.

name.text: q018 Logan, a professional programmer and developer, develops a Web mobile appli

questiontext.text: Logan, a professional programmer and developer, develops a Web mobile application. The application allows users to book cabs for rides within the city. Which of the following languages is Logan most likely to have used to develop this app?

name.text: q019 Which of the following statements is TRUE of Web applications developed for

questiontext.text: Which of the following statements is TRUE of Web applications developed for mobile systems?

answer.text: They can be developed by professional programmers and technically oriented Web developers or business professionals.
They are more expensive than native applications of equivalent complexity.
It is easier to earn money from a thin-client application.

name.text: q020 A browser provides a more-or-less consistent environment for a Web applicat

questiontext.text: A browser provides a more-or-less consistent environment for a Web application when it is developed to be run outside the browser.

name.text: q021 The cost of native applications is very low when compared to Web applicatio

questiontext.text: The cost of native applications is very low when compared to Web applications.

name.text: q022 A native application is a thick-client application that is designed to work

questiontext.text: A native application is a thick-client application that is designed to work with a particular operating system.

name.text: q023 Native mobile applications only run on the operating system for which they

questiontext.text: Native mobile applications only run on the operating system for which they are programmed.

name.text: q024 Native mobile applications can be developed by technically oriented Web dev

questiontext.text: Native mobile applications can be developed by technically oriented Web developers and business professionals.

name.text: q025 Professional programming languages such as Objective-C and VB.Net are prefe

questiontext.text: Professional programming languages such as Objective-C and VB.Net are preferred to develop Web mobile applications.

name.text: q026 The advantages of using the html5 version of Web application are the suppor

questiontext.text: The advantages of using the html5 version of Web application are the support for graphics, animation, 2D animations, and other sophisticated user experiences.

name.text: q027 Web applications are limited by the capabilities of the browser.

questiontext.text: Web applications are limited by the capabilities of the browser.

name.text: q028 The major advantage of native applications over Web applications is that th

questiontext.text: The major advantage of native applications over Web applications is that they will run on any operating system and mobile device.

name.text: q029 Unlike native applications, Web applications have one code base and one dev

questiontext.text: Unlike native applications, Web applications have one code base and one development team.

name.text: q030 Differentiate between native and Web mobile applications.

questiontext.text: Differentiate between native and Web mobile applications.

graderinfo.text:
Native mobile applications are developed using serious, heavy-duty, professional programming languages such as Objective-C, Java, and VB.Net. All of these languages are object-oriented, which means they can be used to create difficult, complex applications, and, if used properly, will result in high-performance code that is easy to alter when requirements change. Object-oriented languages can only be used by professional programmers who have devoted years to learning object-oriented design and coding skills. The downside of native applications is that they only run on the operating system for which they are programmed. As a general rule, the cost of native applications is high.
Web development languages are html5, CSS3, and Java Script. Web applications can be written by professional programmers. However, it is possible for technically oriented Web developers and business professionals to develop them as well. Web applications are limited by the capabilities of the browser. While browsers are becoming increasingly sophisticated, they cannot offer the full capabilities of the underlying operating system and hardware. The major advantage of webs over native applications is that they will run on any operating system and mobile device.

name.text: q031 Which of the following is TRUE of quality mobile user experiences?

questiontext.text: Which of the following is TRUE of quality mobile user experiences?

answer.text: Users' content must occupy limited display space on mobile systems.
Use of content to drive application behavior is called indirect interaction.
Applications must be designed to one scale, so that they fit one particular display appropriately.
Power usage on mobile devices can be minimized by moving complex code to cloud servers.

name.text: q032 Megan has downloaded a new gaming application on her smartphone. When she s

questiontext.text: Megan has downloaded a new gaming application on her smartphone. When she starts using it, she realizes that command icons and a navigation bar, intended for better user interface, block more than half the screen on her phone. Megan is disappointed with the app and immediately deletes it. With reference to this scenario, which of the following features does the gaming application need to improve?

name.text: q035 Which of the following is TRUE of push data?

questiontext.text: Which of the following is TRUE of push data?

answer.text: It is data that a device requests from a server.
It is less impressive to users than pull data.
It is uploaded by the user onto a server.
The user needs to do nothing to receive it.

name.text: q036 ________ data is data that the device requests from the server.

questiontext.text: ________ data is data that the device requests from the server.

name.text: q037 Chrome is a term that refers to the visual overhead in a computer display.

questiontext.text: Chrome is a term that refers to the visual overhead in a computer display.

name.text: q038 Direct interaction is the usage of content to drive application behavior.

questiontext.text: Direct interaction is the usage of content to drive application behavior.

name.text: q039 Context-sensitive chrome pops up in the display when appropriate.

questiontext.text: Context-sensitive chrome pops up in the display when appropriate.

name.text: q040 Charms refers to the ability to move activities, especially long-running tr

questiontext.text: Charms refers to the ability to move activities, especially long-running transactions, across devices.

name.text: q041 Push data is data that the device requests from the server.

questiontext.text: Push data is data that the device requests from the server.

name.text: q042 When some applications move complex code onto powered and powerful cloud se

questiontext.text: When some applications move complex code onto powered and powerful cloud servers, it improves the security.

name.text: q043 Explain the role of feature content in a quality mobile application.

questiontext.text: Explain the role of feature content in a quality mobile application.

graderinfo.text: Quality mobile user interfaces should place the primary emphasis on users' content, giving such content as much of the display as possible. Rather than show menus, toolbars, and heavy window borders, the content should be shown cleanly and in center stage. Chrome is a term that refers to the visual overhead in a computer display. It is the windows, the menus, and other apparatus that drive the application. Because mobile screen size is often limited, modern mobile applications eliminate it as much as possible. The use of content to drive application behavior is called direct interaction.

name.text: q044 State the primary characteristics of a quality mobile application.

questiontext.text: State the primary characteristics of a quality mobile application.

graderinfo.text:
The primary characteristics of a quality mobile application are:
1. Feature content and supporting direct interaction
2. Using context-sensitive chrome when needed
3. Providing animation and lively behavior
4. Designing to scale and share (display and data)
5. Using the cloud

name.text: q045 What is roaming? What are its applications?

questiontext.text: What is roaming? What are its applications?

graderinfo.text:
Roaming occurs when users move their activities, especially long-running transactions (reading a book, for example) across devices. The best mobile applications do this transparently; the user need take no action. Kindle apps inform iPad users about the most recently viewed page of a book when they open it on an iPhone. This is done entirely automatically.
Roaming can achieve greater power when mobile applications allow roaming for other long-running transactions as well; editing a document, spreadsheet, or other Office documents are examples. At some point, applications like CRM and ERP may support roaming as well. In this context, push data is data that the server sends to or pushes onto the device whereas pull data is data that the device requests from the server.

name.text: q046 UTN Technologies, a software company, allows its employees to use their mob

questiontext.text: UTN Technologies, a software company, allows its employees to use their mobile systems at work. The management noticed a significant increase in employee satisfaction after the policy was instated. Which of the following will be an added advantage to UTN as a result of the policy?

answer.text: no real danger of lost or damaged data

name.text: q047 Which of the following is a disadvantage of employees using their mobile sy

questiontext.text: Which of the following is a disadvantage of employees using their mobile systems at work?

name.text: q048 The advantages of employees using their mobile systems at work include cost

questiontext.text: The advantages of employees using their mobile systems at work include cost savings and greater employee satisfaction.

name.text: q049 The disadvantages of employees using mobile systems at work include a great

questiontext.text: The disadvantages of employees using mobile systems at work include a greater need for training.

name.text: q050 State the advantages and disadvantages of employee use of mobile systems at

questiontext.text: State the advantages and disadvantages of employee use of mobile systems at work.

graderinfo.text:
The advantages of employee use of mobile systems at work include cost savings. It also leads to greater employee satisfaction of using devices that employees chose according to their own preferences rather than organization-supplied PCs. Because employees are already using these devices for their own purposes, they need less training and can be more productive. This implies reduced support costs.
On the other hand, employee use of mobile devices has significant disadvantages. There is the real danger of lost or damaged data. When data is brought into employee-owned computing devices, the organization loses control over where it goes or what happens to it. Organizations also lose control over the updating of software and the applications that users employ. This control loss leads to compatibility problems as well. Possibly the greatest disadvantage of employee use of their own devices is the risk of infection.

name.text: q051 Mobile systems have limited possibilities.

questiontext.text: Mobile systems have limited possibilities.

answer.text: the ability to be always connected

name.text: q068 Is it better for an organization to develop a web-based or native applicati

questiontext.text: Is it better for an organization to develop a web-based or native application?

graderinfo.text: The choice depends on your strategy, your particular goals, the requirements for your application, your budget, your schedule, your tolerance for managing technical projects, your need for application revenue, and other factors. In general, Web native applications are cheaper to develop and maintain, but they may lack the wow factor. You and your organization have to decide for yourselves!

name.text: q069 Excessive pushing is not annoying.

questiontext.text: Excessive pushing is not annoying.

name.text: q070 Only about 40 percent of companies have created an official mobile-use BYOD

questiontext.text: Only about 40 percent of companies have created an official mobile-use BYOD policy.

name.text: q001 Which of the following is TRUE of a data model?

questiontext.text: Which of the following is TRUE of a data model?

answer.text: It is created after the database is designed.
It is an attribute whose value is associated with only one entity instance.
It is a logical representation of the structure of the data.
It does not describe the relationships among the data.

name.text: q002 Once the users have validated and approved the data model, it is transforme

questiontext.text: Once the users have validated and approved the data model, it is transformed into a ________.

name.text: q003 A data model is a logical representation of the structure of the data.

questiontext.text: A data model is a logical representation of the structure of the data.

name.text: q004 A data model does not depict the relationships among the data.

questiontext.text: A data model does not depict the relationships among the data.

name.text: q005 A data model contains a description of both the data and the relationships

questiontext.text: A data model contains a description of both the data and the relationships among the data.

name.text: q006 Explain the database development process.

questiontext.text: Explain the database development process.

graderinfo.text: A database application consists of forms, reports, queries, and application programs. At first, the developers interview users and develop the requirements for the new system. During this process, the developers analyze existing forms, reports, queries, and other user activities. The requirements for the database are then summarized in a data model, which is a logical representation of the structure of the data. The data model contains a description of both the data and the relationships among the data. It is similar to a blueprint. Once the users have validated and approved the data model, it is then transformed into a database design. After that, the design is implemented in a database, and that database is then filled with user data.

name.text: q007 Which of the following is a highly popular technique for creating a data mo

questiontext.text: Which of the following is a highly popular technique for creating a data model with which the developers describe the content of a database by defining what is to be stored in the database and the associations among them?

name.text: q008 Which of the following is TRUE of entities?

questiontext.text: Which of the following is TRUE of entities?

answer.text: Entities have an identifier whose value is associated with every entity in the data model.
Entities can only represent a logical construct or transaction, not a physical object.
The characteristics of entities are described by attributes.
The names of entities are always plural.

name.text: q009 Carol, an online shopping customer, raises a complaint stating she had plac

questiontext.text: Carol, an online shopping customer, raises a complaint stating she had placed an order for books two weeks ago but has still not received them. Nigel, in charge of handling complaints for the site, wants to verify Carol's complaint. He tracks the order number and the order date for Carol's books. The data that Nigel is tracking are also called ________.

name.text: q010 Which of the following statements is TRUE of identifiers?

questiontext.text: Which of the following statements is TRUE of identifiers?

answer.text: They are constraints on minimum requirements in a relationship.
They are data that users want to track.
They highlight instances of data duplication in a database.
They are attributes, or group of attributes, whose values are associated with only one entity instance.

name.text: q011 Which of the following is TRUE of an entity-relationship (E-R) diagram?

questiontext.text: Which of the following is TRUE of an entity-relationship (E-R) diagram?

answer.text: Each entity is shown in separate triangles.
Many-to-many relationships are generally denoted by N:N.
A crow's foot represents a 1:N relationship between two entities.
Crow's foot is a shorthand representation for a single relationship between entities.

name.text: q012 Roger teaches a Chemistry class at the state university. Each student in th

questiontext.text: Roger teaches a Chemistry class at the state university. Each student in the class can only be tutored by Roger; however, he can tutor multiple students. In a data model, this relationship is best represented as a(n) ________.

name.text: q013 Which of the following notations signifies that an adviser can be related t

questiontext.text: Which of the following notations signifies that an adviser can be related to many students and that a student can be related to many advisers?

name.text: q014 An example of a ________ relationship includes one student being assigned t

questiontext.text: An example of a ________ relationship includes one student being assigned to one gym locker.

name.text: q015 The angled lines in an entity-relationship (E-R) diagram used as shorthand

questiontext.text: The angled lines in an entity-relationship (E-R) diagram used as shorthand to represent multiple relationships are referred to as a(n) ________.

name.text: q016 Maximum cardinality in an entity-relationship (E-R) diagram refers to the m

questiontext.text: Maximum cardinality in an entity-relationship (E-R) diagram refers to the maximum number of ________.

answer.text: entities that can be involved in a relationship
identifiers possible in a particular diagram

name.text: q017 Entities have attributes that describe characteristics of the entity.

questiontext.text: Entities have attributes that describe characteristics of the entity.

name.text: q018 An identifier is an attribute whose value is associated with every entity i

questiontext.text: An identifier is an attribute whose value is associated with every entity in the data model.

name.text: q019 Entities have relationships to attributes but not to each other.

questiontext.text: Entities have relationships to attributes but not to each other.

name.text: q020 In an entity-relationship (E-R) diagram, a line is used to represent a rela

questiontext.text: In an entity-relationship (E-R) diagram, a line is used to represent a relationship between two entities.

name.text: q021 The notation N:N is used to indicate a many-to-many relationship in an E-R

questiontext.text: The notation N:N is used to indicate a many-to-many relationship in an E-R diagram.

name.text: q022 While representing the relationship between two entities in an entity-relat

questiontext.text: While representing the relationship between two entities in an entity-relationship diagram, the N:N notation is used to indicate that the same number of entities are present on each end of the relationship.

name.text: q023 1:N means that more than one entity is allowed on each side of the relation

questiontext.text: 1:N means that more than one entity is allowed on each side of the relationship.

name.text: q024 The crow's foot notation shows the minimum number of entities that can be i

questiontext.text: The crow's foot notation shows the minimum number of entities that can be involved in a relationship.

name.text: q025 The maximum number of entities that can be involved in a relationship is kn

questiontext.text: The maximum number of entities that can be involved in a relationship is known as maximum cardinality.

name.text: q026 In an entity-relationship diagram, a vertical bar on the lines indicates th

questiontext.text: In an entity-relationship diagram, a vertical bar on the lines indicates that at least one entity of that type is required in the relationship.

name.text: q027 What are the different types of relationships represented in a data model?

questiontext.text: What are the different types of relationships represented in a data model?

graderinfo.text: Entities in a data model have relationships with each other. Database designers use diagrams called entity-relationship (E-R) diagrams to explain the relationships. The relationships can be of three types: one-to-one, one-to-many, and many-to-many. The one-to-one relationship is denoted by 1:1 and one-to-many is denoted by 1:N. Many-to-many relationships are denoted by N:M.

name.text: q028 Explain the difference between maximum and minimum cardinality.

questiontext.text: Explain the difference between maximum and minimum cardinality.

graderinfo.text: Cardinality is the number of entities that can be involved in a relationship. There can be both a maximum and minimum constraint on cardinality. The maximum number of entities that can be involved in a relationship is known as maximum cardinality. Constraints on minimum requirements (minimum entities) are called minimum cardinalities.

name.text: q029 The process of converting poorly structured tables into two or more well-st

questiontext.text: The process of converting poorly structured tables into two or more well-structured tables is referred to as ________.

name.text: q030 The data integrity problem can occur if data are ________.

questiontext.text: The data integrity problem can occur if data are ________.

name.text: q031 Normalized tables eliminate ________.

questiontext.text: Normalized tables eliminate ________.

name.text: q032 The general goal of normalization is to ________.

questiontext.text: The general goal of normalization is to ________.

answer.text: create a copy of an existing table
establish relationships among the entities in a table
convert two or more tables into a single table
construct tables such that every table has a single topic

name.text: q033 Database practitioners classify tables into various ________ depending on t

questiontext.text: Database practitioners classify tables into various ________ depending on the kinds of problems they have.

name.text: q034 Normalization is a database design concept that helps to construct well-str

questiontext.text: Normalization is a database design concept that helps to construct well-structured tables.

name.text: q035 The data integrity problem can occur only if data are missing.

questiontext.text: The data integrity problem can occur only if data are missing.

name.text: q036 The general goal of normalization is to construct tables such that every ta

questiontext.text: The general goal of normalization is to construct tables such that every table has a single topic or theme.

name.text: q037 Tables that are not normalized likely have data integrity problems.

questiontext.text: Tables that are not normalized likely have data integrity problems.

name.text: q038 Database practitioners classify tables into various normal forms according

questiontext.text: Database practitioners classify tables into various normal forms according to the kinds of problems they have.

name.text: q039 To represent an N:M relationship between two entities, two normalized table

questiontext.text: To represent an N:M relationship between two entities, two normalized tables are sufficient.

name.text: q040 How is a data model transformed into a database design?

questiontext.text: How is a data model transformed into a database design?

graderinfo.text: Database design is the process of converting a data model into tables, relationships, and data constraints. The database design team transforms entities into tables and expresses relationships by defining foreign keys. The tables in a model must be normalized before they are converted into designs. Normalization is the process of converting poorly structured tables into two or more well-structured tables. Database practitioners classify tables into various normal forms according to the kinds of problems they have. Transforming a table into a normal form to remove duplicated data and other problems is called normalizing the table. After normalizing, the designer should represent the relationship among those tables to complete the design.

name.text: q041 What are the steps involved in transforming a data model into a relational

questiontext.text: What are the steps involved in transforming a data model into a relational database design?

graderinfo.text: The first step in transforming a data model into a relational database design involves the creation of a table for each entity by the database designer. The identifier of the entity becomes the key of the table. Each attribute of the entity becomes a column of the table. Next, the resulting tables are normalized so that each table has a single theme. Once that has been done, the next step is to represent the relationship among those tables.

name.text: q042 The easiest time to change the database structure is ________.

questiontext.text: The easiest time to change the database structure is ________.

name.text: q043 The easiest time to change the database structure is after the database has

questiontext.text: The easiest time to change the database structure is after the database has been constructed and loaded with data.

name.text: q044 Explain the role of users in designing a database.

questiontext.text: Explain the role of users in designing a database.

graderinfo.text: A database is a model of how the users view their business world. This means that the users are the final judges as to what data the database should contain and how the records in that database should be related to one another. The easiest time to change the database structure is during the data modeling stage. So the user should be actively involved in the modeling process. The user review of a data model is crucial. The data model must accurately reflect the user's view of the business. Users should devote the time necessary to thoroughly review a data model, as any mistakes will be difficult and costly to correct.

name.text: q045 Who should validate and approve the data model?

questiontext.text: Who should validate and approve the data model?

name.text: q046 What is the next step after the users validate the data model?

questiontext.text: What is the next step after the users validate the data model?

name.text: q047 In an entity relationship diagram, constraints on minimum requirements are

questiontext.text: In an entity relationship diagram, constraints on minimum requirements are called ________.

name.text: q048 Entities have relationships with each other.

questiontext.text: Entities have relationships with each other.

name.text: q049 Jackie is a new database administer. She notices that many of the tables ar

questiontext.text: Jackie is a new database administer. She notices that many of the tables are poorly constructed. What should she do to create more well-structured tables?

answer.text: Jackie should delete the table and begin again.
Jackie should create a new database.
There is nothing Jackie can do; once the tables are created they are set.

name.text: q050 Data integrity problems are not serious and can be easily fixed.

questiontext.text: Data integrity problems are not serious and can be easily fixed.

name.text: q051 It is not necessary for a user to understand the data model. The IT departm

questiontext.text: It is not necessary for a user to understand the data model. The IT department will handle any misunderstandings.

name.text: q052 Database developers know what entities and attributes are needed, and don't

questiontext.text: Database developers know what entities and attributes are needed, and don't need input from users.

name.text: q053 It is important to for users to understand how to code entities.

questiontext.text: It is important to for users to understand how to code entities.

name.text: q054 What is the first step in transforming a data model into a database design?

questiontext.text: What is the first step in transforming a data model into a database design?

name.text: q055 User review of the data model is crucial as they are the final judges of wh

questiontext.text: User review of the data model is crucial as they are the final judges of what data the database should contain.
